questions.question: Which Act governs GI protection in India?
questions.explanation: The Geographical Indications of Goods (Registration and Protection) Act, 1999 governs GI in India.

questions.question: Where is the GI Registry located in India?
questions.explanation: The Geographical Indications Registry is located in Chennai, Tamil Nadu.

questions.question: Which international agreement made India create the GI Act?
questions.explanation: India enacted the GI Act, 1999 to comply with the TRIPS Agreement obligations.

questions.question: Who can apply for GI registration in India?
options: Associations of producers or authorized organizations
questions.explanation: Only associations of producers, organizations, or authorities representing producers can apply for GI.

questions.question: What is the term of GI registration in India?
questions.explanation: GI registration is valid for 10 years and can be renewed indefinitely.

questions.question: What type of penalties exist for GI violations in India?
questions.explanation: The GI Act provides for both civil remedies (injunctions, damages) and criminal penalties.

questions.question: Which was the first GI registered in India?
questions.explanation: Darjeeling Tea was the first Geographical Indication registered in India in 2003.

questions.question: Can an individual farmer apply for GI registration?
options: No, only associations or organizations can apply
questions.explanation: Individual farmers cannot apply; only associations, organizations, or authorities can apply for GI.

questions.question: What does TRIPS stand for?
options: Trade Rights in Products and Services
Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights
questions.explanation: TRIPS stands for Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights.

questions.question: What is the role of the GI Registry?
options: To examine and register GI applications
questions.explanation: The GI Registry examines applications and maintains the register of Geographical Indications.

questions.question: What happens after GI registration expires?
options: It can be renewed for another 10 years
questions.explanation: GI registration can be renewed indefinitely for successive 10-year periods.

questions.question: Which section of the GI Act deals with registration?
questions.explanation: Section 11 of the GI Act deals with the application for registration of geographical indications.

questions.question: What is the minimum imprisonment for GI infringement in India?
questions.explanation: The GI Act provides for imprisonment of not less than 6 months for infringement.

questions.question: Can a GI registration be cancelled?
options: Yes, if it was wrongly registered or conditions are not met
questions.explanation: GI registration can be cancelled if it was wrongly registered or if conditions are not maintained.

questions.question: What must be included in a GI application?
options: Product name, geographical area, qualities, and proof of origin
questions.explanation: A GI application must include the product name, geographical area, unique qualities, and proof of origin.

questions.question: Who enforces GI rights in India?
options: Registered proprietors and authorized users can take legal action
questions.explanation: Registered proprietors and authorized users can take civil and criminal action against infringement.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the GI Act, 1999?
options: To provide legal protection to geographical indications in India
questions.explanation: The GI Act provides legal protection and registration framework for geographical indications in India.

questions.question: Can a GI be assigned or transmitted?
options: No, GI cannot be assigned or transmitted
questions.explanation: Unlike trademarks, GI cannot be assigned, transmitted, or licensed as it's a collective right.

questions.question: What year was the GI Act enacted in India?
questions.explanation: The Geographical Indications of Goods Act was enacted in 1999.

questions.question: What is the role of 'authorized users' in GI?
options: They can sell the GI to others
They are producers authorized to use the GI tag
questions.explanation: Authorized users are producers from the region who are authorized to use the registered GI tag.

questions.question: Which body administers the GI Registry?
options: Controller General of Patents, Designs and Trade Marks
questions.explanation: The GI Registry is administered by the Controller General of Patents, Designs and Trade Marks.

questions.question: What is the maximum fine for GI infringement?
questions.explanation: The GI Act provides for a fine which may extend to ₹2 lakhs for infringement.

questions.question: When did Darjeeling Tea get GI registration?
questions.explanation: Darjeeling Tea was registered as a GI in 2003, becoming India's first registered GI.

questions.question: What must producers prove to use a GI tag?
options: They are from the designated geographical area and meet quality standards
questions.explanation: Producers must be from the designated area and meet the specified quality standards to use the GI tag.

questions.question: Can a GI be registered for a product from multiple regions?
options: Yes, if the product has similar qualities from multiple defined regions
Only if the regions are adjacent
questions.explanation: A GI can cover multiple regions if the product has similar qualities linked to those geographical areas.
